sen.j: 津村 禮次郎（つむら れいじろう、1942年 -）は能楽師。
sen.e: Reijiro TSUMURA (1942 -) is a Noh actor.
Reijiro TSUMURA (1942 -) is a Noh actor.
Reijiro TSUMURA (1942 -) is a Noh actor.

sen.j: 人間国宝（重要無形文化財（能楽総合）保持者）。
sen.e: Human National Treasure (holder of the title of Important Intangible Cultural Asset (Noh art in general))

sen.cmt: 括弧内括弧を[]に訂正しました。

tit.cmt: 人物 Personal Profile 用語統一リストより訂正しました。

sen.j: 海外公演を精力的に行うほか、西洋音楽作曲家やオペラ歌手との共同制作上演や、現代演劇とのコラボレーションなど新境地の開拓を行う。
sen.e: He actively performs in foreign countries and explores new realms of activity including joint production and performances with Western music composers and opera singers and collaborative performance with modern dramas.

He actively performs in foreign countries and explores new realms of activity including joint production and performances with Western music composers and opera singers and collaborative performance with modern dramas.

He actively performs in foreign countries and explores new realms of activity including joint production and performances with Western music composers and opera singers and collaborative performance with modern dramas.
He became a Human Natural Treasure in 1991.
He became a Human Natural Treasure in 1991.
He became a Human Natural Treasure in 1991.

tit.cmt: 略歴 Brief Personal History 用語統一リストより訂正しました。

sen.j: 福岡県北九州市生まれ
sen.e: Born in Kitakyushu City, Fukuoka Prefecture
Born in Kitakyushu City, Fukuoka Prefecture
Born in Kitakyushu City, Fukuoka Prefecture
Graduated from Hitotsubashi University (Department of Economics) in 1964.
1964: Graduated from Hitotsubashi University (Department of Economics)
1964: Graduated from Hitotsubashi University (Department of Economics)

sen.j: 大学在学中一橋観世会で津村紀三子に師事、卒業後は観世喜之 (2世)に師事
sen.e: Became a pupil of Kimiko TSUMURA at the Hitotsubashi Kanze-kai while he was a university student and learned from Yoshiyuki KANZE (second) after graduation.
Became a pupil of Kimiko TSUMURA at the Hitotsubashi Kanze-kai while he was a university student and learned from Yoshiyuki KANZE (second) after graduation.
Became a pupil of Kimiko TSUMURA at the Hitotsubashi Kanze-kai while he was a university student and learned from Yoshiyuki KANZE (second) after graduation.

sen.j: 1967年大内正美、津村紀三子養子となる
sen.e: In 1967, he became an adopted son of Masami OUCHI and Kimiko TSUMURA.
1967: He became an adopted son of Masami OUCHI and Kimiko TSUMURA.
1967: He became an adopted son of Masami OUCHI and Kimiko TSUMURA.

sen.j: 1967年4月日蓮宗本山海光山佛現寺において出家得度(板垣日応上人門弟）
sen.e: In April 1967, a ceremony of shukke tokudo (entry to the priesthood) was held for him at Kaikozan Butsugen-ji Temple, head temple of the Nichiren Sect (disciple of Priest Itagaki Nichiou Shonin).
sen.cmt: 板垣日応上人は Priest Itagaki Nichiou Shonin としました。
sen.e: April 1967: A ceremony of shukke tokudo (entry to the priesthood) was held for him at Kaikozan Butsugen-ji Temple, head temple of the Nichiren sect (disciple of Priest Itagaki Nichio Shonin).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。sect小文字にしました。Nichioに訂正しました。
sen.e: April 1967: A ceremony of shukke tokudo (entry to the priesthood) was held for him at Kaikozan Butsugen-ji Temple, head temple of the Nichiren sect (disciple of Priest Itagaki Nichio Shonin).

sen.j: 1967年8月身延山信行道場修了、僧籍取得
sen.e: Completed the training at Shingyo Dojo (training school) in Mt. Minobu and obtained the priesthood in August 1967.
August 1967: Completed the training at Shingyo Dojo (training school) in Mt. Minobu and obtained the priesthood.
August 1967: Completed the training at Shingyo Dojo (training school) in Mt. Minobu and obtained the priesthood.

sen.j: 1973年文化庁芸術祭 (文化庁)参加（以降毎回参加）
sen.e: Participated in the National Arts Festival (Agency for Cultural Affairs) in 1973 (and continued participation every year thereafter).

1973: Participated in the National Arts Festival (Agency for Cultural Affairs) and continued participation every year thereafter.
Assumed the President of the Ryokusen-kai of the Kanze School in 1974.
sen.cmt: 会主がわかりませんが、President としました。

sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。school小文字にしました。

sen.j: 1991年文化庁重要無形文化財（能楽総合）保持者認定
